3-1-6-1:   CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION REQUIRED:
Every business, occupation and activity must be registered with the Village.
Registration shall be included in all business licenses issued by the Village
and a business license holder does not need to apply for a separate certificate
of registration unless additional registration is required by section
3-1-13 of this chapter. Any business, occupation or activity not required to be
licensed by the Village shall apply for a certificate of registration. The fee
for a certificate of registration is thirty five dollars ($35.00). Registration
fees shall become part of the General Corporate Fund upon collection. (Ord. 08-
1517, 11-11-2008; amd. January 31, 2023; Ord. 22-2055, 10-11-2022)
3-1-7: TERM OF LICENSE OR REGISTRATION; FEE ADJUSTMENTS AND REBATES:
   A.   Term Of License Or Registration; Fees Adjusted: All licenses and
registrations required by this chapter shall be for a full year, and the term
of each shall commence on January 1, or thereafter if it is first granted on a
date thereafter, whichever may be the case, and shall expire the following
December 31, unless otherwise specified or previously revoked, and the full fee
shall be paid at the time of application in the case of all renewals. In the
case of first licenses and registrations for which application is made in the
first quarter of the term, the full fee shall be paid; for those made in the
second quarter of the term, three-fourths (3/4) of the fee shall be paid; for
those made in the third quarter of the term, one-half (1/2) of the fee shall be
paid; and for those made in the last quarter of the term, one-fourth (1/4) of
the fee shall be paid.
   B.   Rebate Of Fee: In no event shall any rebate or refund be made of any
license or registration fee or part thereof by reason of the death of the
licensee or registrant or by reason of nonuse of such license or registration
or by reason of a change in the location of the business, occupation or
activity of such licensee or registrant; provided, however, that the provisions
of this subsection shall not be construed to prevent the Village Clerk from
authorizing a refund of a fee or a portion thereof where the fee was collected
through an error or where a business is forced to close before the expiration
of the license or registration period by reason of the taking over of the
licensed premises by the United States or the State or an agency thereof. In
the event an application shall be denied, the fee accompanying such application
shall be immediately refunded.
   C.   Recalculation Of Fee: When any licensee, by increasing the number of
his employees or the amount of business done by him or the size of his plant or
the number or size of his vehicles or by making any change of any kind in his
business, occupation or activity, places himself in a class where the
provisions of this chapter require him to pay a higher license fee, he shall
pay the additional license fee based on the annual license fee prorated monthly
to the nearest full month for the balance of the license period and shall be
entitled to receive a supplemental license.
   D.   Renewal Of Business Licenses Purchased Prior To September 23, 2008: For
business licenses purchased prior to September 23, 2008, which are paid in full
through March 31, 2009 (hereinafter referred to as "preexisting business
licenses"), renewals shall be made on or before December 31, 2008, however,
only three-fourths (3/4) of the applicable license fee shall be due. The term
of the renewed license shall begin on January 1, 2009, and expire December 31,
2009. All preexisting business licenses which are not renewed by December 31,
2008, shall expire on March 31, 2009. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-8: BOND:
In case the license requested shall be for an activity of a transitory nature
including, but not limited to, circuses, carnivals, street shows or other
activities which, in the judgment of the Village President, with the advice of
the license investigator, may cause the accumulation of litter, debris or other
undesirable accumulation of material on the site after the conclusion of the
activity, the Village President may, in addition to the other requirements of
this chapter, require the posting of a bond in an amount of not less than one
hundred dollars ($100.00) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500.00)
sufficient to guarantee the cleanup and restoration of the site following the
conclusion of such activities. Such bond shall be approved by the Village
President and filed with the Village Clerk. (Ord. 84-374, 7-10-1984)
3-1-9: NONTRANSFERABILITY OF LICENSE OR REGISTRATION:
No licensee or registrant may assign, sell or transfer his or her license or
registration to any other person, even if such other person intends to conduct
the same business, occupation or activity as the licensee or registrant at the
location used by the licensee or registrant. Such other person must apply and
pay the fee for a new license or certificate of registration in accordance with
the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-10: RENEWAL OF LICENSES AND CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION; DUPLICATES:
   A.   Renewal Of License And Registration, Certificate Of Registration And
Contractor's Registration:
      1.   Notice Of Renewal And Investigation: The Village Clerk shall send
written notification of renewal and investigation to be received by licensee or
registrant prior to December 1.
      2.   Application For Renewal: For renewal of licenses and registrations
issued pursuant to the terms of this chapter, written applications are required
in the same manner, form and content as applications for original licenses and
registrations. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
      3.   Failure To Comply With Renewal And Penalties: Renewal of business
license and registration is due annually by December 31. Failure to comply with
renewal by January 1 shall result in a penalty of twenty five dollars ($25.00)
being added to the invoiced renewal fee. Failure to comply with renewal by
January 15 shall result in a penalty of the twenty five dollars ($25.00) plus
ten dollars ($10.00) per day in addition to the invoiced renewal fee.
Noncompliance by February 1 shall result in a ticket and fine of not less than
fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) per
day, in addition to incurred penalties and invoiced fees and/or loss of
license. (Ord. 14-1760, 11-25-2014)
   B.   Duplicates; Fee: In case any licensee or registrant who has been
furnished a license, certificate of registration or license insignia in
accordance with the provisions of this chapter, shall lose the same, it shall
be within the discretion of the Village Clerk to authorize the issuance of a
duplicate license, certificate or insignia upon the making of an affidavit of
loss by such person and the payment of a fee of one dollar ($1.00) to the
Village Clerk. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-11: BUSINESS LICENSES AND CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION; MORE THAN ONE
BUSINESS PER PREMISES:
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this chapter to the contrary, if any
person holding a business license under this chapter engages in any other
business, occupation or activity on the licensed premises in connection with
the licensed business, occupation or activity (hereinafter referred to as
"additional business, occupation or activity"), the licensee will not be
required to obtain or pay for an additional business license therefor; provided
that the fee paid for the licensed business, occupation or activity is at least
equal in the amount to the highest license fee required for such additional
business, occupation or activity, and provided that the additional business,
occupation or activity obtains a certificate of registration, which shall be
issued at no charge. This section shall not be construed so as to relieve any
person from complying with any other regulations applicable to either business.
This exemption shall not apply to any person engaging in the sale of
cigarettes, cigars and tobacco, at retail, or in the sale of alcoholic
beverages, the sale of drug paraphernalia or to vending machines, jukeboxes and
any other devices so specified pursuant to ordinance, and such dealer shall be
required to purchase a license for such cigarette, cigar, tobacco and alcoholic
beverage business and vending machines, jukeboxes and any other device so
specified pursuant to ordinance, notwithstanding the fact that such person may
be engaging in some other business, occupation or activity for which a license
was obtained hereunder. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-12: LICENSE TO BE POSTED:
Every license issued hereunder shall be posted by the licensee in a conspicuous
place, and no license shall be permitted to remain posted after the period of
such license has expired. (Ord. 84-374, 7-10-1984)
3-1-13: ADDITIONAL REGISTRATION REQUIRED FOR CERTAIN BUSINESSES:
   A.   It shall be the duty of all construction and construction trades
contractors and peddlers, solicitors, canvassers and door to door salesmen to
be licensed as herein provided and, in addition thereto, to register their
names, job and job locations or sales programs and sales areas, as the case may
be, with the Village Clerk in the Municipal building for each construction
project or sales program in which they engage within the Village corporate
limits.
   B.   The Superintendent of Streets is hereby directed to post appropriate
signs at the limits of the Village with the following language:
      SOLICITORS, PEDDLERS, CANVASSERS, DOOR TO DOOR SALESMEN AND CONTRACTORS
MUST BE LICENSED AND REGISTERED AT THE SHOREWOOD MUNICIPAL BUILDING.
(Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-14: TAMPERING WITH LICENSE, CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION OR INSIGNIA:
No person shall:
   A.   Add to, alter, deface, forge or counterfeit any license, certificate of
registration, official sticker or other insignia which has been or is being
issued by the Village.
   B.   Destroy, obliterate, take, remove or carry away without the consent of
the owner any license, certificate of registration, official sticker or other
insignia which has been issued by the Village; except, that said license,
certificate, sticker or other insignia may be removed after the licensed
business, occupation or activity has been discontinued or the licensed or
registered premises has been abandoned. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-15: BUILDING AND PREMISES REQUIREMENTS:
No license or registration shall be issued for the conduct of any business,
occupation or activity if the premises and building to be used for such purpose
do not fully comply with all applicable provisions of all other ordinances of
the Village and fire district, including fire prevention, building and zoning
regulations 1 . (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
 
Notes
1 1. See titles 8 and 10 of this Code.
3-1-16: CONTRACTOR'S LICENSE FOR ALL PERSONS ENGAGED IN CONTRACTOR WORK IN THE
VILLAGE:
(Rep. by Ord. 19-1925, 1-22-2019, eff. 2-1-2019)
3-1-17: COMPLIANCE WITH STATE LAWS:
   A.   It shall be the duty of each licensee and registrant to comply with all
applicable Statutes of the State pertaining to the business, activity or
occupation, and failure to so comply shall be cause, in addition to other
causes set forth herein, for revocation of a Village issued business license of
such licensee failing to so comply.
   B.   All licensees and registrants under this chapter using scales and
devices in their businesses shall comply with all applicable Statutes of the
State dealing with weights and measures, and all such devices requiring
certification by the State must at all times bear such certification. A
violation of this subsection shall be cause for revoking the license of such
licensee. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-18: INSPECTIONS AND ANALYSES:
   A.   Wherever inspections of the premises, vehicles, equipment or methods of
operation used in conducting a licensed business, occupation or activity are
authorized or required by this chapter or are reasonably necessary to secure
compliance with any provision hereof or to detect violations hereof, it shall
be the duty of the licensee or person in charge of such premises, vehicles,
equipment or methods of operation to permit, at any reasonable time, any
officer or employee of the Village who is authorized or directed to make such
inspections to be admitted to such premises to have access to such vehicles or
equipment and to observe such methods of operation for the purpose of making
said inspections.
   B.   Whenever an analysis of any commodity or material is reasonably
necessary to secure conformance with any provision of this chapter or to detect
violations hereof, it shall be the duty of the licensee, upon request, to give
any authorized officer or employee of the Village requesting the same
sufficient samples of such material or commodity for such analysis.
   C.   In addition to any other penalty which may be provided, the Village
President may revoke the license of any licensee who refuses to permit any such
officer or employee to make such inspections or take such samples of materials
or commodities or who interferes with such officer or employee while in the
performance of this duty in making such inspections; provided, however, that no
license shall be revoked for such cause unless written demand is made upon the
licensee or person in charge of the premises, in the name of the Village,
stating that such inspection or sample is desired at the time it is sought to
make the inspection or to obtain the sample.
   D.   Wherever inspections of the premises, vehicles, equipment used in
conducting a registered business or occupation are reasonably necessary to
verify compliance with fire protection, zoning and building regulations, the
registrant or person in charge of such premises, vehicles, or equipment shall
permit, at any reasonable time, any officer or employee of the Village who is
authorized or directed to make such inspections to be admitted to such premises
or to have access to such vehicles or equipment for the purpose of making said
inspections. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-19: REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION OF LICENSE:
If the Chief Building Official or any official of the Village shall have cause
to believe that a violation of any of the provisions of this chapter have
occurred which would be grounds for revocation, suspension or refusal to renew
a license, a written notice shall be sent to the last known place of business
of the licensee informing of the alleged violations, what action will be taken
if the licensee does not respond within ten (10) days of the date of the letter
and giving an opportunity to have a hearing before the President and Board of
Trustees. In the event a situation exists that is dangerous to the health,
safety and welfare of the citizenry, the said inspector shall apply to the
President for an immediate order suspending the license. A letter shall be sent
advising of the action taken, why it was taken and that it will be a permanent
action unless within ten (10) days the licensee should apply for a hearing
before the President and Board of Trustees seeking reinstatement of the
privileges. (1994 Code; amd. Ord. 20-1982, 8-25-2020)
3-1-20: ENFORCEMENT:
It shall be the duty of the head of the department or official of the Village
charged with the enforcement of any regulatory provision of this chapter, other
than the mere procurement of a license, to take such action to the extent
permitted by law as shall be necessary to compel compliance with said
regulatory provision. Such department head or official shall have authority to
call upon the Police Department for aid in the enforcement of said regulatory
provision, and it shall be the duty of the Chief of Police, when called upon,
to act according to the instructions of such department head or official and to
perform such duties as may be required of him in order to enforce or put into
effect said regulatory provision. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
3-1-21: VIOLATION AND PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate the provisions of this title shall, upon
conviction, be subject to a fine as provided in section
1-4-1 of this Code. Each day the violation continues shall be considered a
separate violation. For failure to apply for a required license or registration
and/or failure to pay a required license or registration fee, the Village shall
send notice of the violation via certified mail, return receipt requested, or
via hand delivery and shall inform the person in violation that they have
thirty (30) days in which to come into compliance; if the violation is not
cured within thirty (30) days after such notice is sent, then the fine shall be
the amount of the fee due and owing plus one hundred dollars ($100.00) and each
day after that in which the violation continues there shall be a fine of ten
dollars ($10.00) per day; these fines are in addition to any other penalty
allowed by Federal, State, County or local law, or otherwise provided in this
chapter. (Ord. 08-1517, 11-11-2008)
CHAPTER 2
OCCUPATION TAXES
SECTION:
3-2-1: Utilities Tax
3-2-2: Hotel And Motel Accommodations Tax
3-2-3: Utilities Tax; Electricity
3-2-4: Home Rule Municipal Retailers' And Service Occupation Taxes
3-2-5: Village Privilege Tax On The Purchase Of Motor Fuel
3-2-1: UTILITIES TAX:
   A.   Definitions: For the purposes of this section the following definitions
shall apply:
   GROSS RECEIPTS: The consideration received for the transmission of messages
or for distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas or electricity for
use or consumption and not for resale, as the case may be, and for all services
rendered in connection therewith valued in money, whether received in money or
otherwise, including cash, credit, services and property of every kind and
material and for all services rendered therewith deduction on account of the
cost of transmitting said messages, without any deduction on account of the
cost of the service, product or commodity supplied, the cost of materials used,
labor or service cost or any other expenses whatsoever.
   PERSON: Any natural individual, firm, trust, estate, partnership,
association, joint stock company, joint venture, corporation, municipal
corporation or political subdivision of this state or a receiver, trustee,
conservator or other representative appointed by order of any court.
   TRANSMITTING MESSAGES: In addition to the usual and popular meaning of
person to person communication, shall include the furnishing, for a
consideration, of services or facilities (whether owned or leased) or both to
persons in connection with the transmission of messages where such persons do
not, in turn, receive any consideration in connection therewith, but shall not
include such furnishing of services or facilities to persons for the
transmission of messages to the extent that any such service or facilities for
the transmission of messages are furnished for a consideration by such persons
to other persons for the transmission of messages. (Ord. 99-948, 7-13-1999)
   B.   Tax Imposed: A tax is imposed on all persons engaged in the following
occupations or privileges:
      1.   Persons engaged in the business of transmitting messages by means of
electricity or radio magnetic waves, or fiber optics, at the rate of five
percent (5%) of the gross receipts from such business originating within the
corporate limits of Shorewood; provided however, that such tax shall not apply
to prepaid telephone calling arrangements as defined in section 2-27 of the
Illinois retailers occupation tax act;
      2.   Persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying,
furnishing or selling gas for use or consumption within the corporate limits of
Shorewood, Illinois, and not for resale, at the rate of five percent (5%) of
the gross receipts therefrom. (Ord. 02-1091, 3-12-2002, eff. 5-1-2002)
   C.   Exemptions From Tax: No tax is imposed by this section with respect to
any transaction in interstate commerce or otherwise to the extent to which such
business may not, under the constitution and statutes of the United States, be
made subject to taxation by this state or any political subdivision thereof,
nor shall any persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying,
furnishing or selling gas or electricity or engaged in the business of
transmitting messages be subject to taxation under the provisions of this
section for such transactions as are or may become subject to taxation under
the provisions of the "municipal retailer's occupation tax act" 1  authorized
by section 5/8-11-1 et seq., of the Illinois municipal code approved May 29,
1961, as amended 2 . (Ord. 99-948, 7-13-1999)
   D.   Tax Is Additional: Such tax shall be in addition to the payment of
money or value of products or services furnished to this municipality by the
taxpayer as compensation for the use of its streets, alleys or other public
places or installation and maintenance therein, thereon or thereunder of poles,
wires, pipes or other equipment used in the operation of the taxpayer's
business.
   E.   Tax Returns; Payment Of Tax:
      1.   On or before December 31, 1967, each taxpayer shall make a return to
the village treasurer for the months of August, September and October 1967,
stating:
         a.   His name.
         b.   His principal place of business.
         c.   His gross receipts during those months upon the basis of which
the tax is imposed.
         d.   Amount of tax.
         e.   Such other reasonable and related information as the corporate
authorities may require.
      2.   On or before the last day of each third month thereafter, each
taxpayer shall make a like return to the village treasurer for each
corresponding three (3) month period.
      3.   The taxpayer making the return herein provided for shall, at the
time of making such return, pay to the village treasurer the amount of tax
herein imposed; provided, that in connection with any return, the taxpayer may,
if he so elects, report and pay an amount based upon his total billings of
business subject to the tax during the period for which the return is made
(exclusive of any amounts previously billed) with prompt adjustments of later
payments based upon any differences between such billings and the taxable gross
receipts.
   F.   Overpayments: If it shall appear that an amount of tax has been paid
which was not due under the provisions of this section, whether as the result
of a mistake of fact or any error of law, then such amount shall be credited
against any tax due, or to become due, under this section from the taxpayer who
made the erroneous payment; provided, that no amounts erroneously paid more
than three (3) years prior to the filing of a claim therefor shall be so
credited.
   G.   Time Limit On Collection Of Tax: No action to recover any amount of tax
due under the provisions of this section shall be commenced more than three (3)
years after the due date of such amount.
   H.   Effect Of Provisions: This section shall take effect after publication,
and the tax provided for herein shall be based on the "gross receipts", as
herein defined, actually paid to the taxpayer for services billed on or after
August 1, 1967.
   I.   Violation And Penalty: Any taxpayer who fails to make a return or who
makes a fraudulent return or who wilfully violates any other provision of this
section is guilty of a violation of this title, and, upon conviction thereof,
shall be subject to penalty as provided in section
1-4-1 of this code and, in addition, shall be liable in a civil action for the
amount of tax due. (Ord. 0-194, 7-23-1974, eff. 8-1-1974; amd. 1994 Code)
 
Notes
1 1. 35 ILCS 120/1 et seq.
2 2. 65 ILCS.
3-2-2: HOTEL AND MOTEL ACCOMMODATIONS TAX:
   A.   Tax Established: There is hereby established a hotel and motel
accommodations tax in the village.
   B.   Definitions: For the purposes of this section, whenever any of the
following words, terms or definitions are used herein, they shall have the
meanings ascribed to them in this subsection:
   DIRECTOR OF FINANCE OR DIRECTOR: The village administrator of the village of
Shorewood.
   HOTEL ACCOMMODATIONS; MOTEL ACCOMMODATIONS: A room or rooms in any building
or structure kept, used, maintained, advertised or held out to the public to be
an inn, motel, hotel, apartment hotel, lodging house, dormitory or place where
sleeping, rooming, office, conference or exhibition accommodations are
furnished for lease or rent, whether with or without meals.
   PERMANENT RESIDENT: Any normal person who occupies or has the right to
occupy any room or rooms in a hotel or motel for at least thirty (30)
consecutive days.
   PERSON: Any natural person, receiver, administrator, executor, conservator,
assignee, trust in perpetuity trust, estate, firm, copartnership, joint
venture, club, company, business trust, domestic or foreign corporation,
association, syndicate, society or any group of individuals acting as a unit,
whether mutual, cooperative, fraternal, nonprofit or otherwise. Whenever the
term "person" is used in any clause prescribing and imposing a penalty, the
term as applied to associations shall mean the owners or part-owners thereof,
and as applied to corporations, the officers thereof.
   C.   Tax Imposed; Exemption:
   1.   There is hereby imposed and shall immediately accrue and be a collected
a tax upon the rental or leasing of any hotel or motel accommodation in the
Village at the rate of ten percent (10 %) percent of the gross rental or
leasing charge.
      2.   The tax imposed under this section shall not apply to the renting or
leasing of any hotel or motel accommodations to permanent residents. If hotel
or motel accommodations are provided for both permanent residents and other
guests, the rental obtained from the permanent residents shall not be included
in the computation of the tax due.
   D.   Liability For Payment Of Tax: The ultimate incidence of and liability
for payment of said tax shall be borne by the lessee or tenant of any such
hotel or motel accommodations. The tax herein levied shall be in addition to
any and all other taxes, and it shall be the duty of every owner, manager or
operator of hotel and motel accommodations to secure said tax from the lessee
or tenant of said hotel or motel accommodations and pay over to the village
said tax under rules and regulations prescribed by the director of finance and
as otherwise provided by this section.
   E.   Collection Of Tax: The tax herein levied shall be secured by the hotel
owner, manager or operator from the lessee or tenant when collecting the price,
charge or rent to which it applies. Every lessee or tenant shall be given a
bill, invoice, receipt or other statement or memorandum of the price, charge or
rent payable upon which the hotel or motel accommodations tax shall be stated,
charged and shown separately.
   F.   Tax Return; Payment Of Tax: Every owner, manager or operator of a hotel
or motel accommodation within the Village shall file on a monthly basis with
the Finance Director a form prescribed by the Director showing tax receipts
collected with respect to the hotel or motel accommodation during the preceding
month. At the time of the filing, the owner, manager or operator of the hotel
or motel accommodation shall pay to the Village all taxes due with respect to
that month. The form shall be filed and the taxes paid on or before the 20th of
each month.
   G.   Failure To Pay Tax:
      1.    If for any reason the tax is not paid or required forms are not
filed on a timely basis, the Village shall proceed with the procedures as set
forth in Title 1 Chapter 13 (1-13-1 et. seq.) entitled "Locally Imposed and
Administered Tax Rights and Responsibilities".
      2.   The Finance Director may direct the Village Attorney to bring any
action necessary to enforce the payment and filing requirements of this
Section.
      3.   If the village administrator shall find that any person has wilfully
avoided payment of the tax imposed by this section, said administrator shall
cause a written notice to be sent to the last known place of business of such
licensee informing him that his village license will be suspended or revoked
within ten (10) days of the date of the notice unless the tax is paid in full.
If the taxpayer feels he has reason to protest such action, he shall be given
an opportunity to be heard before the president and board of trustees, such
hearing to be applied for, in writing, within ten (10) days of the date of the
notice of such license revocation or suspension. The village board shall set a
hearing date and time within thirty (30) days from the date of receiving the
request for hearing, and notify said aggrieved licensee of such hearing time
and date. The suspension or revocation of any license shall not release or
discharge the owner, manager or operator of hotel or motel accommodations from
his civil liability for the payment of the tax nor for prosecution of such
offense.
   H.   Records Kept: Every owner, manager or operator of hotel accommodations
in the village shall keep books and records showing the prices, rents or
charges made or charged and occupancies taxable under this section. The
director of finance or his designate shall, at all reasonable times, have full
access to said books and records.
   I.   Disposition Of Proceeds Of Tax: The proceedings resulting from the
imposition of the tax under this section shall be paid into treasury of the
Village and shall be credited to the Corporate Fund to be used for any lawful
purpose.
   J.   Penalties: Any person found guilty of violating, disobeying, omitting,
neglecting or refusing to comply with or resisting or opposing the enforcement
of any of the provisions of this section, except when otherwise specifically
provided, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as provided in
section
1-4-1 of this code. (Ord. 90-539, 5-8-1990; amd. 1994 Code; Ord. 01-1056, 6-12-
2001; Ord. 24-2102, 4-23-2024)
3-2-3: UTILITIES TAX; ELECTRICITY:
   A.   Definitions: For the purposes of this section the following definitions
shall apply:
   EXEMPT PURCHASER: A unit of local government or school district.
   PERSON: Any natural individual, firm, trust, estate, partnership,
association, joint stock company, joint adventure, corporation, limited
liability company, municipal corporation, the state or any of its political
subdivisions, any state university created by statute, or a receiver, trustee,
conservator or other representative appointed by order of any court.
   PERSON MAINTAINING A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THIS STATE: Any person having or
maintaining within this state, directly or by a subsidiary or other affiliate,
an office, generation facility, distribution facility, transmission facility,
sales office or other place of business, or any employee, agent or other
representative operating within this state under the authority of the person or
its subsidiary or other affiliate, irrespective of whether such place of
business or agent or other representative is located in this state permanently
or temporarily, or whether such person, subsidiary or other affiliate is
licensed or qualified to do business in this state.
   PURCHASE AT RETAIL: Any acquisition of electricity by a purchaser for
purposes of use or consumption, and not for resale, but shall not include the
use of electricity by a public utility, as defined in section 8-11-2 of the
Illinois municipal code 1 , directly in the generation, production,
transmission, delivery or sale of electricity.
   PURCHASER: Any person who uses or consumes, within the corporate limits of
the village of Shorewood, electricity acquired in a purchase at retail, other
than an exempt purchaser.
   TAX COLLECTOR: The person delivering electricity to the purchaser. (Ord. 99-
942, 5-25-1999)
   B.   Tax Imposed: Pursuant to section 8-11-2 of the Illinois municipal code
2  and any and all other applicable authority, a tax is imposed upon the
privilege of using or consuming electricity acquired in a purchase at retail
and used or consumed within the corporate limits of the village of Shorewood at
the following rates, calculated on a monthly basis for each purchaser:
      1.   For the first 2,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.559 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      2.   For the next 48,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.375 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      3.   For the next 50,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.363 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      4.   For the next 400,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.254 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      5.   For the next 500,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.225 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      6.   For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.200 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      7.   For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.175 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      8.   For the next 5,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.150 cents per kilowatt-hour;
      9.   For the next 10,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month;
0.125 cents per kilowatt-hour; and
      10.   For all electricity used or consumed in excess of 20,000,000
kilowatt-hours in a month; 0.100 cents per kilowatt-hour. (Ord. 02-1090, 3-12-
2002, eff. 5-1-2002)
   C.   Tax Is Additional: Such tax is in addition to all taxes, fees, and
other revenue measures imposed by the village, the state or any other political
subdivision in the state.
   D.   Effective Date: The tax shall be imposed with respect to the use or
consumption of electricity by residential customers beginning with the first
bill issued on or after August 1, 1999; and with respect to the use or
consumption of electricity by nonresidential customers beginning with the first
bill issued to such customers for delivery services in accordance with section
16-104 of the public utilities act 3 , or the first bill issued to such
customers on or after January 1, 2001, whichever issuance occurs sooner.
   E.   Constitutional Provisions: Notwithstanding any other provision of this
Section, the tax shall not be imposed if and to the extent that imposition or
correction of the tax would violate the Constitution or statutes of the United
States or the constitution of the State of Illinois.
   F.   Collection:
      1.   Subject to the provisions of subsection H of this Section regarding
the delivery of electricity to resellers, the tax imposed under this Section
shall be collected from purchasers by the person maintaining a place of
business in this State who delivers electricity to such purchasers. This tax
shall constitute a debt of the purchaser to the person who delivers the
electricity to the purchaser and is recoverable at the same time and in the
same manner as the original charge for delivering the electricity.
      2.   Any tax required to be collected by this Section, and any tax in
fact collected, shall constitute a debt owed to the Village by the person
delivering the electricity, provided, that the person delivering electricity
shall be allowed credit for such tax related to deliveries of electricity, the
charges for which are written off as uncollectible, and provided further, that
if such charges are thereafter collected, the delivering supplier shall be
obligated to remit such tax.
      3.   Persons delivering electricity shall collect the tax from the
purchaser by adding such tax to the gross charge for delivering the
electricity. Persons delivering electricity shall also be authorized to add to
such gross charge an amount equal to three percent (3%) of the tax they collect
to reimburse them for their expenses incurred in keeping records, billing
customers, preparing and filing returns, remitting the tax and supplying data
to the Village upon request. For purposes of this Chapter, any partial payment
of a billed amount not specifically identified by the purchaser shall be deemed
to be for the delivery of electricity.
   G.   Remittance And Return:
      1.   Every tax collector shall on a monthly basis file a return in a form
prescribed by the Village Administrator. The return and accompanying remittance
shall be due on or before the last day of the month following the month during
which the tax is collected or is required to be collected under subsection F of
this Section.
      2.   If the person delivering electricity fails to collect the tax from
the purchaser or is excused from collecting the tax under subsection H5 of this
Section, then the purchaser shall file a return in a form prescribed by the
Village Administrator and pay the tax directly to the Village on or before the
last day of the month following the month during which the electricity is used
or consumed.
   H.   Resales:
      1.   Electricity that is delivered to a person in the Village shall be
considered to be for use and consumption by that person unless the person
receiving the electricity has an active resale number issued by the Village
Administrator and furnishes that number to the person who delivers the
electricity, and certifies to that person that the sale is either entirely or
partially nontaxable as a sale for resale.
      2.   If a person who receives electricity in the Village claims to be an
authorized reseller of electricity, that person shall apply to the Village
Administrator for a resale number. The applicant shall state facts showing why
it is not liable for the tax imposed by this Section on any purchases of
electricity and shall furnish such additional information as the Village
Administrator may reasonably require.
      3.   Upon approval of the application, the Village Administrator shall
assign a resale number to the applicant and shall certify the number to the
applicant.
      4.   The Village Administrator may cancel the resale number of any person
if the person fails to pay any tax payable under this Section for electricity
used or consumed by the person, or if the number: a) was obtained through
misrepresentation, or b) is no longer necessary because the person has
discontinued making resales.
      5.   a. If a reseller has acquired electricity partly for use or
consumption and partly for resale, the reseller shall pay the tax imposed by
this Section directly to the Village Administrator pursuant to subsection G2 of
this Section on the amount of electricity that the reseller uses or consumes
and shall collect the tax pursuant to subsection F of this Section and remit
the tax pursuant to subsection G1 of this Section on the amount of electricity
delivered by the reseller to a purchaser.
         b.   Any person who delivers electricity to a reseller having an
active resale number and complying with all other conditions of this subsection
shall be excused from collecting and remitting the tax on any portion of the
electricity delivered to the reseller, provided that the person reports to the
Village Administrator the total amount of electricity delivered to the
reseller, and such information that the Village Administrator may reasonably
require.
   I.   Books And Records: Every tax collector and every taxpayer required to
pay the tax imposed by this Section, shall keep accurate books and records of
its business or activity, including contemporaneous books and records denoting
the transactions that gave rise, or may have given rise, to any tax liability
under this Section. The books and records shall be subject to and available for
inspection at all times during business hours of the day.
   J.   Credits And Refunds: Notwithstanding any other provision of this
Section, in order to permit sound fiscal planning and budgeting by the Village,
no person shall be entitled to a refund of, or credit for, a tax imposed under
this Section unless the person files a claim for refund or credit within one
year after the date on which the tax was paid or remitted.
   K.   Overpayment And Credit: If a taxpayer under this Section is unable to
use a credit authorized by this Section solely because the tax imposed by this
Section has been replaced by the tax imposed under the kilowatt hour tax, then
the taxpayer may apply such credits against any tax due under the kilowatt hour
tax. (Ord. 99-942, 5-25-1999)
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-2.
2 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-2.
3 1. 220 ILCS 5/16-104.
3-2-4: HOME RULE MUNICIPAL RETAILERS' AND SERVICE OCCUPATION TAXES:
   A.   Home Rule Municipal Retailers' Occupation Tax Imposed: Effective
January 1, 2016, a tax is hereby imposed upon all persons engaged in the
business of selling tangible personal property, other than an item of tangible
personal property titled or registered with an agency of the state of Illinois,
at retail in the village of Shorewood at the rate of 1.75 percent (1.75%) on
the gross receipts from these sales made in the course of such business. Such
"home rule municipal retailers' occupation tax" shall not be applicable to the
sales of food for human consumption that is to be consumed off the premises
where it is sold (other than alcoholic beverages, soft drinks and food that has
been prepared for immediate consumption) and prescription and nonprescription
medicines, drugs, medical appliances and insulin, urine testing materials,
syringes and needles used by diabetics. The imposition of this home rule tax is
pursuant to the provisions of section 8-11-1 of the Illinois municipal code 1 .
   B.   Home Rule Municipal Service Occupation Tax Imposed: Effective January
1, 2016, a tax is hereby imposed upon all persons engaged in the village of
Shorewood in the business of making sales of service, at the rate of 1.75
percent (1.75%) of the selling price of all tangible personal property
transferred by such serviceman, either in the form of tangible personal
property or in the form of real estate, as an incident to a sale of service.
Such "home rule municipal service occupation tax" shall not be applicable to
the sales of food for human consumption which is to be consumed off the
premises where it is sold (other than alcoholic beverages, soft drinks and food
which has been prepared for immediate consumption) and prescription and
nonprescription medicines, drugs, medical appliances and insulin, urine testing
materials, and syringes and needles used by diabetics. The imposition of this
home rule tax is pursuant to the provisions of section 8-11-5 of the Illinois
municipal code 2 .
   C.   Collection By State: The taxes hereby imposed and all civil penalties
that may be assessed as an incident thereto, shall be collected and enforced by
the department of revenue of the state of Illinois. (Ord. 15-1789, 8-11-2015)
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-1, as amended.
2 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-5, as amended.
3-2-5: VILLAGE PRIVILEGE TAX ON THE PURCHASE OF MOTOR FUEL:
   A.   Entitlement: This subchapter shall be known and cited as the "Village
Privilege Tax on the Purchase of Motor Fuel at Retail Subchapter" and the tax
herein imposed shall be known as the "Village Privilege Tax on the Purchase of
Motor Fuel."
   B.   Definitions: For purposes of this chapter, the following words and
phrases shall have the following meanings:
   DIESEL FUEL: A motor fuel used for internal combustion in diesel engines.
   MOTOR FUEL: All volatile and inflammable liquids produced, blended, or
compounded for the purpose of, or which are suitable or practicable for,
operating motor vehicles.
   PERSON: Any natural person, receiver, administrator, executor, conservator,
assignee, trust in perpetuity, trust, estate, firm, partnership, joint venture,
club, company, business trust, domestic or foreign corporation, association,
syndicate, society or any group of individuals acting as a unit, whether
mutual, cooperative, fraternal, nonprofit or otherwise. Whenever the term
PERSON is used in any clause prescribing and imposing a penalty, the term as
applied to associations shall mean the owners or part owners thereof, and as
applied to corporations, the officers thereof.
   PURCHASER: Any natural person, receiver, administrator, executor,
conservator, assignee, trust in perpetuity, trust, estate, firm, partnership,
joint venture, club, company, business trust, domestic or foreign corporation,
association, syndicate, society or any group of individuals acting as a unit,
whether mutual, cooperative, fraternal, nonprofit or otherwise, but does not
include any unit of local government.
   RETAIL: The sale for any good and valuable consideration to a person for use
as a consumer.
   RETAILER: Any person, firm or corporation engaged in the business of selling
Motor Fuel or Diesel Fuel at retail, and not for resale.
   C.   Tax Imposed. There is hereby imposed and levied within the Village a
tax upon the retail purchase of Motor Fuel at the rate of five cents ($0.05)
per gallon and Diesel Fuel at the rate of eight cents ($0.08) per gallon. This
tax shall be in addition to any and all other taxes.
   D.   Liability For Payment. The ultimate incidence and liability for payment
of such tax shall be upon the retail Purchaser of motor fuel. Nothing herein
shall be construed to impose a tax upon the occupation of selling motor fuel.
It shall be the duty of every Retailer to secure the tax from each Purchaser
and pay over to the Village the tax under rules and regulations prescribed by
the Village Administrator and as otherwise provided in this subchapter.
   E.   Collection Of Tax. Every Retailer required to collect the tax levied by
this subchapter shall secure the tax from the Purchaser at the time they
collect payment for the fuel.
   F.   Filing Of Return. On the 20th day of each month the Retailer shall
transmit a report of sale of motor fuel in the previous month to the village
using the Illinois Department of Revenue's Sales and Use Tax Form - ST-1 and
any such other forms, and in such manner, as prescribed by the Village
Administrator. Each report of sale of motor fuel shall be accompanied by a
remittance of the appropriate amount of tax applicable to the sale reported.
   G.   Rules And Regulations. The Village Administrator may promulgate rules
and regulations not inconsistent with the provisions of this subchapter
concerning the enforcement and application of this subchapter. The term "Rules
and Regulations" includes, but is not limited to, a case by case determination
of whether or not the tax imposed herein applies.
   In addition, this Chapter shall be applied and enforced in accordance with
the provisions of the Village's Locally Imposed and Administered Tax Rights and
Responsibility Ordinance, Title 1, Chapter 13, as applicable.
   H.   Failure To Pay Tax. If for any reason any tax is not paid when due, the
Retailer shall pay a penalty as provided in the Village's Locally Imposed and
Administered Tax Rights and Responsibility Ordinance, Title 1, Chapter 13,
Section
1-13-11.
   I.   Records.
      1.   Each Retailer shall keep books and/or records which minimally
include:
         a.   The number of gallons of motor fuel sold at retail each day in
the village; and
         b.   The actual motor fuel tax collected for each day.
      2.   The Village Administrator or his/her designate shall at all
reasonable times have full access to the records.
      3.   To protect the Retailer's right to privacy, the financial records of
any Retailer submitted pursuant to this subchapter or any rule and regulation
promulgated hereunder shall not be available for public inspection.
      4.   The records required by this section shall state separately the
number of gallons of Diesel Fuel and the number of gallons of other Motor Fuels
sold at retail each day in the Village.
   J.   Suspension Or Revocation Of License For Failure To Pay Tax; Hearing. If
after a hearing, as provided herein, the Village President finds that any
person has willfully avoided payment of the tax imposed by this subchapter, the
President may suspend or revoke all village licenses held by such person. The
Village President shall provide written notice to the Retailer of any hearing
to be conducted pursuant to this subchapter, the notice shall be mailed by
regular mail not less than five business days prior to the hearing date and
shall be addressed to the Retailer's last known place of business. The Retailer
shall have an opportunity to be heard at such hearing and may be represented by
Counsel. The suspension or revocation of any license shall be in addition to
and not in lieu of any action to recover monies due the village or prosecution
under village ordinances.
   K.   Disposition Of Proceeds Of Tax. All proceeds resulting from the
imposition of the tax under this subchapter, including penalties, shall be paid
into the treasury of the village and shall be expended only for those purposes
authorized by the Safe Roads Amendment to the Illinois Constitution, Article
IX, Section 11. (Ord. 20-1968, 3-10-2020)
